Pre-Game Insights: England holds an edge over Pakistan in overall T20I matches but the unpredictable nature of T20 format gives both teams equal chances to win.
Babar Azam and Co. are heavily dependent on the performance of their pace battery and spinners who have been spot on in the tournament.
With the middle order looking sorted, Pakistanâ€™s batting is also looking good.
England is depending a lot on their opening pair who are among the top 10 run scorers in the tournament.
Babar Azam and Co. will look to draw inspiration from their 1992 ODI World Cup final win over England.
England will aim to avenge the loss from the same year with a win this time.
Pakistan has won their last four completed T20I matches, while England has won their last three matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The final match on Sunday has rekindled memories of the 1992 ODI World Cup final between the two countries where Imran Khan led Pakistan had defeated England.
This is the 100th meeting between the two teams.
